title: AttributeError: module 'torch._C' has no attribute '_cudnn_version'
body_html:
Hi,
I have successfully installed pytorch on windows 7 64 bit with command:
conda install pytorch=0.3.0 cudatoolkit=8 cudnn=6
When I call torch.__version__ I get '0.3.0b0+591e73e' but when I run print( torch.backends.cudnn.version() ) I get error message:
`---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last)
in ()
----> 1 print( torch.backends.cudnn.version() )

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn_init_.py in version()
52
53 def version():
---> 54 if _libcudnn() is None:
55 return None
56 return __cudnn_version

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn_init_.py in _libcudnn()
40 lib.cudnnGetErrorString.restype = ctypes.c_char_p
41 __cudnn_version = lib.cudnnGetVersion()
---> 42 compile_version = torch._C._cudnn_version()
43 # Check that cuDNN major and minor versions match
44 if (__cudnn_version // 100) != (compile_version // 100):

AttributeError: module 'torch._C' has no attribute '_cudnn_version'`

What should I do to check that indeed cuDNN is working?

Hi,
I have successfully installed pytorch on windows 7 64 bit with command:
conda install pytorch=0.3.0 cudatoolkit=8 cudnn=6
When I call torch.__version__ I get '0.3.0b0+591e73e' but when I run print( torch.backends.cudnn.version() ) I get error message:
`---------------------------------------------------------------------------

----> 1 print( torch.backends.cudnn.version() )
C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn_init_.py in version()
52
53 def version():
---> 54     if _libcudnn() is None:
55         return None
56     return __cudnn_version
C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn_init_.py in _libcudnn()

41             __cudnn_version = lib.cudnnGetVersion()
---> 42             compile_version = torch._C._cudnn_version()
43             # Check that cuDNN major and minor versions match
44             if (__cudnn_version // 100) != (compile_version // 100):
AttributeError: module 'torch._C' has no attribute '_cudnn_version'`
What should I do to check that indeed cuDNN is working?
body:
Hi, 
I have successfully installed pytorch on windows 7 64 bit with command:
`conda install pytorch=0.3.0 cudatoolkit=8 cudnn=6`
When I call `torch.__version__` I get `'0.3.0b0+591e73e'` but when I run `print( torch.backends.cudnn.version() )` I get error message:
`---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-2e0c1c373ea5> in <module>()
----> 1 print( torch.backends.cudnn.version() )

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py in version()
     52 
     53 def version():
---> 54     if _libcudnn() is None:
     55         return None
     56     return __cudnn_version

C:\Development\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py in _libcudnn()
     40             lib.cudnnGetErrorString.restype = ctypes.c_char_p
     41             __cudnn_version = lib.cudnnGetVersion()
---> 42             compile_version = torch._C._cudnn_version()
     43             # Check that cuDNN major and minor versions match
     44             if (__cudnn_version // 100) != (compile_version // 100):

AttributeError: module 'torch._C' has no attribute '_cudnn_version'`

What should I do to check that indeed cuDNN is working?
